Name: Earth
Description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life. About 71% of Earth's surface is made up of the ocean, dwarfing Earth's polar ice, lakes, and rivers.
Atmosphere: Nitrogen, Oxygen, Argon, Carbon Dioxide, Water Vapour.

Name: 55 Cancri e
Description: A molten surface planet with sparkling silicate skies. Approximately 8 times heavier than Earth with twice the diameter.

Name: Kepler 22b
Description: Super-Earth, thought to be an ocean-like planet.
Atmosphere: Volatile composition with a liquid or gaseous outer shell.

Name: Upsilon Andromedae b
Description: A giant planet composed mainly of gas, it has no solid surface.

Name: HD 80606 b
Description: Storms, rotation, atmospheric heating, and a volatile orbit are all plainly visible.

Name: HD 189733 b
Description: The cobalt blue colour comes from a hazy, blow-torched atmosphere containing clouds laced with glass. Winds send the glass storming sideways at 8690 kmh.
